Review: This is one of those rare moments when you should trust the negative reviews. Elsa Pataky was fine in the small roles she had in the Fast and Furious films but she is not an action star and her acting can not support a film on its own. Apart from that the cgi in this is TERRIBLE, it looks like you are watching a direct to video film from the 80s. The writing is awful, the one liners in this are so generic and completely uninspired. The action in this is also very bland and the fight scenes are too repetitive. Nothing about this movie is fresh or entertaining, I'm not sure who the target audience is supposed to be but this is one movie that you should avoid.

Review Title: Terrible movie and I hate the politics they put in it as well.
Review: Look, I'm all for equal rights and everything but I'm so tired of seeing some chick that weighs 100 pounds beat the crap out of some dude who is 250 pounds of muscle. She also beats the hell out of a martial artist.She then gets a call from Madame President who tells her to defend that place at all costs. To bad she is stuck in the room with a diverse man who likes to say "We are all going to die!". He also tells her that he is useless and hasn't fired a gun since basic training. She reminds him that guns still shoot the same (insert laugh). Sigh. They also did the standard white man in the movie is the evil person.Eventually these studios are going to get tired of losing money and realize that they should focus on making a good script instead of worrying about putting politics into our entertainment. We watch movies to be entertained and to escape the daily crap that happens in the world. We don't watch to be preached at.

Review: Interceptor is something like Die Hard (or Under Siege) but instead John McClane wie get a G. I. Jane, and like those Die Hard movies this one is also full of implausible things and events happening - but it got no Bruce Willis or Alan Rickman in the cast to compensate the plot holes by charismatic performances, also the action and fighting scenes are no way of the same quality. Anyway, production is okay for a B flick, acting solid, but the whole story is just one big cliche, a formulaic, generic affair, and therefore I really don't know why I should recommend Interceptor to you. Hopefully, one day some coding hexer will develop an algorithm that can write better, more interesting and entertaining stories, as those human writers are able to write these days.

Review: It turns out that the defense that Russia's 6,000 atomic bombs have to break through is only 20 or 30 anti-missile missiles! Well, double the number, because there is another similar system - although it (also) was easily destroyed by a battle group of only six or seven people!Moreover, the dozens of "think tanks" in the presidential palace did not contribute even a single idea from beginning to end.Moreover, those huge missile launchers, which are said to be impossible to find with all the strength of the United States and Russia, are actually deployed in the most conspicuous places.The most disgusting thing is that the command center, which is said to have only one exit, the room protected by the highest level of security doors, actually has exits up and down! And its reliability is equivalent to the basement door of an ordinary American rural house!Blah blah blah... There are so many places to complain. But I actually finished it! After thinking about it for a long time, it should be because the actors and photography are not bad.To sum it up again: the vast majority of screenwriters in America are really stupid. And they think audiences are stupid enough to make money just by fooling around... Sadly, that's likely to be the case.
